protected  int AbstractTokenizer.readWhitespaces(int startingAtPos, int maxChars)
          This method detects the number of whitespace characters starting at the given position.
protected  int AbstractTokenizer.readString(int startingAtPos, int maxChars)
          This method reads characters in a string until it detects the end of the string (this is the end sequence of the string, '"' in C and Java) It should use AbstractTokenizer.getChar(int) or AbstractTokenizer.getCharUnchecked(int) to retrieve a character to check.
protected  TokenizerProperty AbstractTokenizer.isSequenceCommentOrString(int startingAtPos)

protected  int AbstractTokenizer.readMoreData()

          The number of characters until the next comment, whitespace, string, special sequence or separator are determined.
protected  boolean AbstractTokenizer.test4Whitespace(Token token)
          Check if the current read position contains a whitespace.
protected  void AbstractTokenizer.completeWhitespace(Token token)
          After having identified a whitespace, this method continues to read data until it detects a non-whitespace.
protected  boolean AbstractTokenizer.isWhitespace(int offset)
          This method checks at the given offset if it is a whitespace.
protected  boolean AbstractTokenizer.test4Separator(Token token)
          Check if the current read position contains a separator.
protected  void AbstractTokenizer.completeSeparator(Token token)
          After having identified a separator, this method stores information about it in the given Token.
protected  boolean AbstractTokenizer.isSeparator(int offset)
          This method checks at the given offset if it contains a separator.
protected  boolean AbstractTokenizer.test4SpecialSequence(Token token)
          Check if the current read position is the start of a special sequence.
protected  void AbstractTokenizer.completeSpecialSequence(Token token)
          After having identified a special sequence, this method completes this sequence and stores information about it in the given Token.

          This method checks at the given offset if it contains a a special sequence.

protected  int AbstractTokenizer.comparePrefix(int offset, java.lang.String prefix, boolean noCase)
          This method compares the characters at the given offset (from the current read position) with the given prefix.

 TokenizerProperty SequenceHandler.isSequenceCommentOrString(int startingAtPos, int maxChars)
          Deprecated. Return a TokenizerProperty if the character starting at the given position comprise a special sequence (like the ++ operator in C and Java or the &bsp; in HTML), a comment starting sequence or a string sign.
